intro: Impatiens marojejyensis var. papillosa, commonly known as the Marojejy Impatiens, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and its stems are often hairy as well. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically found in montane rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
